hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Momentum Fade in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a sharp, high-volume price spike (>3% in 4 hours) driven by a negative news headline (e.g., 'Bitcoin Decline', 'Momentum Wanes') will be followed by a momentum fade and a retracement of at least 50% of the initial spike within the next 24 hours, providing a short-term mean-reversion opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a neutral regime lacking strong directional conviction, extreme moves driven by sentiment/news are often overreactions. The 'little optimism' and 'momentum wanes' narrative suggests a fragile market prone to quick profit-taking on any rallies and covering on sharp sell-offs, leading to a fade.
entry_conditions: BTC or ETH experiences a >3% price move (up or down) within a 4-hour candle on volume >1.5x 20-period average
The move coincides with a timestamp of a major negative news headline from a top-5 crypto news source
Enter on the close of the 1-hour candle following the initial spike candle, in the direction opposite the spike (i.e., short if spike up, long if spike down).

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial spike's range (high-low).
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves beyond the high/low of the initial spike candle by 0.5%.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >55% of such identified spikes in a NEUTRAL regime continue in their initial direction for more than 24 hours, exceeding the spike high/low by >1%, the hypothesis is falsified.
